Package space.sunqian.common.io

package space.sunqian.common.io
Provides utilities and interfaces for IO related, including subpackages.

Utilities:

  • IOKit
  • BufferKit
The IOKit is based on the core I/O operator interface: IOOperator. In addition, this package provides convenient data reading interfaces to simplify the complexity of reading. Here are data reading related interfaces:
  • ByteReader
  • CharReader
  • ByteSegment
  • CharSegment
This package also provides data transformation interfaces that can be used for complex data transformations:
  • ByteProcessor
  • ByteTransformer
  • CharProcessor
  • CharTransformer
These abstract classes are used to implement IO streams with minimal effort.
  • DoReadStream
  • DoReadReader
  • DoWriteStream
  • DoWriteWriter
Subpackages:
  • space.sunqian.common.io.file
  • space.sunqian.common.io.communicate
  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    space.sunqian.common
    The root package of fs, provides root supports for fs: Fs: the core utilities kit; Checker: the core kit for checking and verifying; FsLoader: the loader for implementations of fs; And sub-packages for specific functions: space.sunqian.common.base space.sunqian.common.app space.sunqian.common.cache space.sunqian.common.codec space.sunqian.common.collect space.sunqian.common.concurrent space.sunqian.common.io space.sunqian.common.net space.sunqian.common.object space.sunqian.common.reflect space.sunqian.common.invoke space.sunqian.common.dynamic space.sunqian.common.third
    space.sunqian.common.io.communicate
    Provides interfaces for IO communication, typically for network or IPC (Inter-Process Communication).
    space.sunqian.common.io.file
    Provides utilities and interfaces for file and path.
  • Class
    Description
    BufferKit
    Utilities for Buffer related.
    ByteArrayOperator
    This interface defines a method for processing data from a source array and writing the result into a destination.
    ByteIOOperator
    This interface provides I/O operations for byte.
    ByteProcessor
    This interface represents a processor to process byte data, from the specified data source, through zero or more intermediate operations, finally produces a result or side effect, and the result will be written into a destination (if any).
    ByteReader
    This interface represents the byte data reader to read byte data as ByteSegment from the data source, which may be a byte sequence or a stream.
    ByteSegment
    This interface represents a segment of byte data in the data source.
    ByteTransformer
    This interface is used to transform the input data, typically used for ByteProcessor, to do the specific data transformation work.
    CharArrayOperator
    This interface defines a method for processing data from a source array and writing the result into a destination.
    CharIOOperator
    This interface provides I/O operations for char.
    CharProcessor
    This interface represents a processor to process char data, from the specified data source, through zero or more intermediate operations, finally produces a result or side effect, and the result will be written into a destination (if any).
    CharReader
    This interface represents the char data reader to read char data as CharSegment from the data source, which may be a char sequence or a stream.
    CharSegment
    This interface represents a segment of char data in the data source.
    CharTransformer
    This interface is used to transform the input data, typically used for CharProcessor, to do the specific data transformation work.
    DoReadReader
    This class provides a convenient method to implement Reader.read(char[]) and Reader.read(char[], int, int): DoReadReader.doRead(char[], int, int), which is invoked by DoReadReader.read(char[]) and DoReadReader.read(char[], int, int), and the invoking generates that the parameters passed to the DoReadReader.doRead(char[], int, int) will never cause the IndexOutOfBoundsException.
    DoReadStream
    This class provides a convenient method to implement InputStream.read(byte[]) and InputStream.read(byte[], int, int): DoReadStream.doRead(byte[], int, int), which is invoked by DoReadStream.read(byte[]) and DoReadStream.read(byte[], int, int), and the invoking generates that the parameters passed to the DoReadStream.doRead(byte[], int, int) will never cause the IndexOutOfBoundsException.
    DoWriteStream
    This class provides a convenient method to implement OutputStream.write(byte[]) and OutputStream.write(byte[], int, int): DoWriteStream.doWrite(byte[], int, int), which is invoked by DoWriteStream.write(byte[]) and DoWriteStream.write(byte[], int, int), and the invoking generates that the parameters passed to the DoWriteStream.doWrite(byte[], int, int) will never cause the IndexOutOfBoundsException.
    DoWriteWriter
    This class provides a convenient method to implement Writer.write(char[])/Writer.write(char[], int, int) and Writer.write(String)/Writer.write(String, int, int): DoWriteWriter.doWrite(char[], int, int)/DoWriteWriter.doWrite(String, int, int), which are invoked by DoWriteWriter.write(char[])/DoWriteWriter.write(char[], int, int) and DoWriteWriter.write(String)/DoWriteWriter.write(String, int, int), and the invoking generates that the parameters passed to the DoWriteWriter.doWrite(char[], int, int)/DoWriteWriter.doWrite(String, int, int) will never cause the IndexOutOfBoundsException.
    IOKit
    Utilities for IO related, some methods are provided by a default IOOperator.
    IOMode
    IO mode, blocking or non-blocking.
    IOOperator
    This interface provides I/O operations.
    IORuntimeException
    This runtime class is used to wrap IOException, using Throwable.getCause() to get the cause.
